0.title: BJP only talks about communalism, has no other topics: Baghel
0.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday claimed that the BJP only discusses issues linked to communalism and religious conversion as the party has no other topics to address. Baghel further stated that the state government has always taken action when it received reports of forced religious conversion incidents. "Every person is free to follow their religion," he added.

1.title: Artist I listened to almost everyday: Vikrant condoles Sidhu's death
1.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey has condoled the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed on Sunday in Punjab's Mansa. Vikrant tweeted, "Shocked, numb & at a loss for words. An Artist I listened to almost every single day. A voice one knew was blessed from above. Condolences & prayers for strength to his family & millions of his fans."

2.title: Our song was going to release soon: Salim on Sidhu Moosewala's death
2.article_body: Composer-singer Salim Merchant took to social media to condole the demise of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. Salim shared a picture of himself with Sidhu and wrote, "I'm shocked & saddened by the news. Sidhu was a gem.. our song was going to release very soon.. this is unbelievable." Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

3.title: Very bot-friendly rules: Musk on Twitter allowing 2,400 tweets per day to a user
3.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Twitter has "very bot-friendly rules" after a user tweeted the platform's current technical limits for accounts. Twitter currently allows a user to send 2,400 tweets per day and make up to four changes per hour to their account's email address. Musk earlier put on hold the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter over fake account data.

4.title: He has learnt a lot from Dhoni: Gavaskar on Hardik's captaincy in IPL 2022
4.article_body: Commenting on Hardik Pandya's captaincy style in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said, "It seems as if he has learnt a lot from MS Dhoni. He considers Dhoni his elder brother and...hero." He added, "His man-management style is Dhoni's approach...his success as captain is a positive sign for Team India." Hardik-led GT have reached the IPL final in their debut season.

5.title: Return of terrorism in Punjab: Ashoke Pandit on Sidhu Moosewala's demise
5.article_body: Indian Film & Television Directors' Association President Ashoke Pandit has posted a series of tweets reacting to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's demise. He wrote, "[His] killing in broad day light indicates the return of terrorism in Punjab under the nose of @ArvindKejriwal who was supported by #Khalistanis. Punjab is a border state and it cannot be ruled by terror supporters."

6.title: Train services between India & B'desh resume after 2 yrs: Official
6.article_body: The passenger train services between Bangladesh and India resumed on Sunday, according to a Bangladesh Railway (BR) spokesman. Notably, the passenger train services between the two countries have resumed after a break of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The train service between Dhaka and Kolkata would be operated five days a week, a senior BR official said.

7.title: Ex-Sri Lankan PM summoned by human rights body over May 9 clashes
7.article_body: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka has summoned ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa to obtain a statement from him regarding clashes that broke out in Colombo on May 9. This comes days after Rajapaksa gave a three-hour-long statement to authorities amid allegations that his party's supporters attacked anti-government protesters in the clashes. At least 10 people died due to violence.

8.title: Urge everyone to stay calm, guilty will be punished: Kejriwal on Moosewala's killing
8.article_body: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said he spoke to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann about the murder of Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa, adding that the killing was "sad and shocking". He said, "The culprits will be given the harshest punishment. I request everyone to stay strong and maintain calm." Those involved in the killing won't be spared, Mann said.

9.title: Abject law & order breakdown in Punjab: Badal on Moosewala's death
9.article_body: Reacting to the murder of Congress leader and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal said that Punjab exhibits an "abject breakdown of law and order". Expressing shock, Badal added that those responsible for the crime should be arrested immediately. Moosewala was reportedly shot over 20 times by unknown assailants in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

10.title: Sidhu Moosewala was an icon, hope perpetrators brought to justice: Sophie
10.article_body: Singer Sophie Choudry took to Twitter to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. She wrote, "This is such tragic & shocking news...A music icon, a legend! My deepest condolences to his family & his fans across the world. Hope the perpetrators are brought to justice...This is truly sad."

11.title: Lockie Ferguson bowls fastest delivery of IPL 2022 in final, breaks Umran Malik's record
11.article_body: GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 by clocking 157.3 kmph against RR opener Jos Buttler in the final on Sunday. Ferguson broke the record held by SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who had clocked 157 kmph against DC on May 5. Ferguson replaced Alzarri Joseph in GT's playing XI for the final.

12.title: Defending champion Djokovic enters 13th straight French Open quarters
12.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic reached his 13th consecutive French Open quarter-final following a 6-1, 6-3, 6-3 win against 15th-seeded Diego Schwartzman in the fourth round on Sunday. The top seed is now 16-0 in fourth round matches at Roland Garros. Djokovic hasn't dropped a set in the tournament so far. He awaits Rafael Nadal or Felix Auger-Aliassime in the last-eight.

13.title: He's a legend & will never be forgotten, sad day: Vishal on Sidhu's death
13.article_body: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani reacted to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death, calling it a sad day. Vishal wrote on Twitter, "The news of his demise has cut deep. India has very few authentic modern artists. He was right on top of that list. I'm without words. He's a legend, his voice, his courage & his words will never be forgotten."

14.title: Nobody safe in Punjab: Ex-CM Amarinder on Sidhu Moosewala's murder
14.article_body: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Sunday, while condoling the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "Nobody is safe in Punjab." "The brutal murder of Sidhu Moosewala is shocking...Law and order has completely collapsed in Punjab," Amarinder tweeted. "The AAP government in Punjab has failed miserably," the Congress veteran further said.

15.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director calls Aamir Khan 'mahapurush' in note
15.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan on Sunday shared a note for Aamir Khan on Instagram making a reference to his 1994 film 'Andaz Apna Apna'. Advait wrote, "You're the best, sir...Grand Chess Master, [Rubik's] Cube Meister...the sharpest editor, the most generous producer! Sir, aap...swami ho, antaryaami ho...balki main toh kehta hoon sir, ke aap purush hi nahin... Mahapurush ho!"

16.title: Very shocking & sad: Kapil Sharma mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
16.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma on Sunday took to Twitter to mourn the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa. Kapil tweeted, "Satnam shri Waheguru. very shocking n very sad, a great artist n a wonderful human being, may god give the strengths to his family #sidhumoosewala."

17.title: AAP tinkered with security for publicity: Jakhar on Moosewala's death
17.article_body: BJP's Sunil Jakhar on Sunday termed the murder of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala "utterly shocking", stating that CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government should be held accountable. Jakhar, who recently quit Congress, added that AAP had tinkered with "security issues to gain cheap publicity". Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa a day after police withdrew his security.

18.title: Nadal is favourite to win French Open but favourites don't always win: Goran
18.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic has said 13-time champion Rafael Nadal is the "favourite" to win the 2022 French Open, but "historically the favourites don't always win." He added that Nadal was the favourite last year as well, but he didn't win the title. Djokovic defeated Nadal in the semi-final at French Open last year.

19.title: Sidhu Moosewala died after sustaining 8 bullet wounds
19.article_body: Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala sustained at least eight bullet wounds in the attack on Sunday, police officials said while quoting doctors. More than 20 bullets were fired at the 28-year-old singer by unknown assailants while he was travelling in an SUV. A doctor said that Moosewala was dead when he was brought to hospital.

20.title: Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan persistent threat to Pak's security: UN
20.article_body: Pakistan faces a persistent threat from Afghanistan-based Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), according to a UN report. TTP has up to 4,000 fighters along Afghanistan-Pakistan border, the report said. "TTP has arguably benefited the most of all the foreign extremist groups in Afghanistan from the Taliban takeover. It has conducted numerous attacks and operations in Pakistan," it added.

21.title: Nobody involved will be spared: Punjab CM Mann on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
21.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday said he was "shocked and deeply saddened by the gruesome murder" of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa today. He added, "Nobody involved will be spared. My thoughts and prayers are with his family...I appeal to everyone to stay calm." Moosewala's security was withdrawn recently.

22.title: BJP releases list of 16 Rajya Sabha candidates, fields Sitharaman from K'taka
22.article_body: The BJP on Sunday announced its list of 16 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10. The party has fielded Union ministers Nirmala Sitharaman and Piyush Goyal from Karnataka and Maharashtra, respectively.

23.title: Deeply shocked & saddened: Rahul Gandhi on Sidhu Moosewala's death
23.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Sunday reacted to the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Mansa. "Deeply shocked and saddened by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala. My heartfelt condolences to his loved ones and fans from across the world," said Rahul. Sidhu had fought recent Punjab polls.

24.title: Sridevi was superstar of 80s-90s, she was from south: Rohit Shetty
24.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that actresses like Sridevi and Jaya Prada, who were superstars of the 80s and 90s, were from the south. He further said that when Amitabh Bachchan and Vinod Khanna were at their peak in the 80s, Kamal Haasan entered Bollywood with 'Ek Duuje Ke Liye' which was a hit.

25.title: Pak govt bans rallies in Islamabad after ex-PM's 'Azadi March'
25.article_body: Pakistan's federal government on Friday imposed a permanent ban on entry of rallies and processions in Islamabad. Rallies in the city will only be permitted after a written agreement between organisers and the city's administration. This comes days after clashes broke out at ex-PM Imran Khan 'Azadi March', which was headed towards Islamabad, and led to arrest of several people.

26.title: Who were the highest paid CEOs of Fortune 500 companies in 2021?
26.article_body: Tesla's Elon Musk was the highest paid CEO on the list of Fortune 500 companies in 2021, with a "realised" compensation worth $23.5 billion. He was followed by Apple CEO Tim Cook ($770.5 million), NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang ($561 million) and Netflix co-CEO Reed Hastings ($453.5 million). Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella ranked seventh on the list with $309.4 million compensation.

27.title: RR to bat first against GT in IPL 2022 final, playing XIs announced
27.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bat first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in IPL 2022 final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. RR are fielding an unchanged side, while Lockie Ferguson has replaced Alzarri Joseph in GT's playing XI. GT defeated RR in their previous two matches against each other in IPL 2022.

28.title: Navneet Rana, husband booked for norm violations during event in Maha
28.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana were on Sunday booked along with 15 of their supporters for allegedly violating various norms during a welcome event for the couple in Amravati. According to police, the event obstructed traffic at several spots, while an 'aarti' performed by the couple had loudspeakers in use even after 10 pm.

29.title: Pilot's phone helped track down Nepal plane that went missing with 22 on board
29.article_body: The location of the Tara Air flight that went missing with 22 people, including four Indians, on board on Sunday, was tracked down using the GPS location of the pilot's phone, General Manager of Kathmandu's Tribhuvan International Airport said. Premnath Thakur said that the pilot's phone kept ringing and Nepal Army's helicopter landed in the possible accident area.

30.title: More than 20 bullets were fired at Sidhu Moosewala in Punjab
30.article_body: More than 20 bullets were fired at singer Sidhu Moosewala in the attack that killed him on Sunday, several media reports stated. The singer and Congress leader was travelling in Punjab's Mansa when unidentified assailants attacked him. The attack came a day after his security cover was withdrawn by the Punjab government.

31.title: World's largest cricket jersey unveiled by BCCI during IPL 2022 closing ceremony
31.article_body: The BCCI has set the Guinness World Record by creating the world's largest cricket jersey. The jersey, measuring 66 x 42 metres, was unveiled at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad during the closing ceremony ahead of the IPL 2022 final between Gujarat Titans and Rajasthan Royals. The jersey was made to mark 15 years of IPL.

32.title: Congress condoles Sidhu Moosewala's demise, says 'the murder came as a terrible shock'
32.article_body: The Congress party on Sunday condoled the demise of singer and party leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in an attack in Punjab's Mansa. "The murder of Shri Sidhu Moose Wala, Congress candidate from Punjab & a talented musician, has come as a terrible shock to the Congress party & the entire nation," the party tweeted.

33.title: BJP leader apologises for 'go home & cook' remark against Supriya Sule
33.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrakant Patil on Sunday tendered an apology for his "go home and cook" remark against NCP MP Supriya Sule. Patil's apology came in response to a notice sent to him by state women's commission. "By apologising, he has shown his large-heartedness. I request everyone now to put the matter to rest," Sule said, reacting to the apology.

34.title: Dad was called senile for casting Big B in 'Zanjeer': Director's son
34.article_body: Late director Prakash Mehra's son producer Puneet Mehra has revealed that his father was called senile for casting Amitabh Bachchan in 1973 film 'Zanjeer'. Puneet further said, "People thought...'Why is he taking someone who hasn't had hits? Why isn't he going with a newcomer instead?'...Property was at stake, mom's jewellery was at stake. This is exactly how 'Zanjeer' was made."

35.title: Mexico reports its first confirmed case of monkeypox
35.article_body: The first confirmed case of monkeypox was identified in Mexico on Saturday, according to Deputy Health Secretary Hugo López-Gatell Ramírez. The patient is a 50-year-old permanent resident of New York who is being treated in Mexico City, he said. The patient is being isolated and is in stable condition, he added.

36.title: Sidhu Moosewala's security cover was withdrawn by Punjab govt a day ago
36.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's security was withdrawn by the Punjab government a day before he was shot dead on Sunday. Moosewala was among around 400 people whose securities were withdrawn recently. The singer-turned-Congress leader was killed after around 30 rounds of bullets were fired by unidentified assailants at him in Jawaharke village.

37.title: I really want them to win: Akmal to ex-team RR ahead of IPL 2022 final
37.article_body: Veteran Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal, who was part of Rajasthan Royals' title winning squad in IPL 2008, said he wants his ex-team to win the IPL 2022 title against GT. "Good to see RR in final...Congratulations to RR's fans, team and management. Best of luck to both teams," he tweeted. It is RR's first final since 2008.

38.title: They were unlucky to lose: Murphy on Liverpool's Champions League loss
38.article_body: Ex-Liverpool player Danny Murphy has said Liverpool were unlucky to lose in the 2022 Champions League final against Real Madrid. "Jurgen Klopp's players will be devastated by the result but they should sleep soundly because overall they were the better team," he added. Real Madrid beat Liverpool 1-0 to win a record-extending 14th title in Paris.

39.title: Sri Lanka to pay $72.6 mn for Russian oil amid economic crisis
39.article_body: Sri Lanka will pay $72.6 million to buy a 90,000-tonne ship consignment of Russian oil that has been docked at Colombo's port for weeks, Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said on Saturday. Wijesekera added that the payment will help restart the country's sole refinery. Sri Lanka recently hiked the petrol price to LKR 420/litre amid the ongoing economic crisis.

40.title: Video shows bullet holes in Sidhu Moosewala's car after attack that killed him
40.article_body: A video showing bullet holes in singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's car windshield after fatal attack in Punjab's Mansa has surfaced online. The singer was shot dead by unknown assailants and two other people were also reportedly injured in the attack. A doctor said the singer was brought dead to the hospital.

41.title: Carlo Ancelotti becomes most successful manager in Champions League history
41.article_body: Carlo Ancelotti has become the most successful manager in European Cup/Champions League history after leading Real Madrid to glory in 2022 final in Paris. Ancelotti became the first manager to win the tournament four times. He led AC Milan to victory in 2003 and 2007 and led Real Madrid to victory in 2014 during his first spell with the club.

42.title: The worst is behind Vodafone Idea, you just have to wait: Kumar Mangalam Birla
42.article_body: Aditya Birla Group's billionaire Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla told BQ Prime that "the worst is behind" Vodafone Idea. "It takes some time to get people to start feeling confident about a business...again," Birla, who co-owns the company with Vodafone Group, said. "We'll have to see how things pan out. I'm very positive about it...You just have to wait," he added.

43.title: Fan walks 264 km to meet Ram Charan, creates portrait in paddy field
43.article_body: A fan of actor Ram Charan has walked 264 km to meet him from Telangana's Gadwal. The man named Jairaj has also paid a tribute to the actor by creating an artistic portrait of him with rice crops in his paddy field in Gadwal's Gorlakhan Doddi. Pictures of Ram Charan interacting with the fan have gone viral on social media.

44.title: India Post delivers mail using drone for the first time in Gujarat
44.article_body: For the first time, India Post delivered a mail using a drone as part of a pilot project in Gujarat's Kutch, covering a distance of 46 km in 25 minutes, officials said on Sunday. "With the success of this pilot project, it'll now be possible to make postal deliveries by drones in the future," the Press Information Bureau (PIB) said.

45.title: Singer Sidhu Moosewala shot dead in Punjab
45.article_body: Punjabi Singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab on Sunday. The singer was rushed to a hospital after he was allegedly attacked in Jawaharke village in Mansa District. Several videos and pictures purportedly showing the singer at the hospital in the state have also surfaced online.

46.title: Parent asks IAS officer how to prepare Class 5 daughter for IAS; officer shares text
46.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a screenshot of a text message he received from a parent, seeking his guidance to prepare their daughter, who is in Class 5, to become an IAS officer. "What should I reply to this message," Sharan wrote. Responding to Sharan's tweet, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan replied, "They are already late."

47.title: Drunk man rams car into two-wheeler in Mumbai, 1 dead
47.article_body: A 23-year-old man died and his sister suffered serious injuries after a man, who was driving in inebriated condition, rammed his car into their two-wheeler in Mumbai on Sunday, according to a police official. "We found liquor bottles in the car," the official said. "The car has been seized as part of the probe," the official added.

48.title: Search & rescue operations for missing Nepal flight called off for today: Official
48.article_body: Search and rescue operations for the missing Tara Air flight that is suspected to have crashed near a river in Nepal, have been called off for today, the General Manager of Tribhuvan International Airport said. Operations were called off due to snowfall at the possible air crash site, Premnath Thakur said. The flight was carrying 22 passengers including four Indians.

49.title: Man booked for impersonating Delhi Police chief to threaten lawyer
49.article_body: An FIR has been registered against an unknown man, who threatened a Delhi-based lawyer while impersonating Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana. The accused threatened to implicate the lawyer in a false case, police said, adding that the accused had used Asthana's photo as his profile picture on Truecaller. Police suspect that the accused is part of an extortion racket.

50.title: Too little too late: Shatrughan on Aryan's clean chit in drugs case
50.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha reacted to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, calling it "too little too late". He further said it seems like "politics of vendetta", adding that Aryan was victimised for being Shah Rukh Khan's son. "I can understand the pain...Shah Rukh...must have gone through," he said.

51.title: Indian Navy decommissions INS Gomati after 34 years of service
51.article_body: INS Gomati, a Godavari class guided-missile frigate, was decommissioned by the Indian Navy on Saturday after 34 years of service. The ship had been deployed in Operation Cactus, Operation Parakram and Operation Rainbow. The ship's legacy will be kept alive in an open air museum being set up on the banks of Gomti river in Lucknow, according to a report.

52.title: Which countries were India's biggest trade partners in 2021-22?
52.article_body: The US has emerged as India's biggest trade partner in 2021-22 with $119.42 billion in bilateral trade, while China is at the second spot ($115.41 billion). UAE ($72.9 billion), Saudi Arabia ($42.85 billion) and Iraq ($34.33 billion) are among India's top five trade partners. Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, South Korea and Australia are in the top 10 list.

53.title: 300 people barge into Gurugram school during board exams, booked
53.article_body: A group of 300 people allegedly forcefully entered a private school in Gurugram's Pataudi when Class 12 CBSE students were giving their board examinations, police said. The group allegedly manhandled the school staff and also abused and misbehaved with the principal. Police teams were rushed to the school to neutralise the situation and evict the miscreants, who were later booked.

54.title: FTII waste-picker who acted in over 20 student films dies at 82 in Pune
54.article_body: Parvati Limbaji Suryavanshi aka Parubai, who used to be a waste-picker on campus of Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) in Pune, died due to age related issues on Thursday. Parubai was 82 years old. Reports said that she had acted in over 20 student films and relied on the money she received from students for acting in projects.

55.title: Man kills wife for resisting bid to 'sell' minor daughter in Pak
55.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pakistan's Sindh province was allegedly killed by her husband for resisting his bid to get their minor daughter married. The accused, Zulfiqar, who was arrested on Friday, had reportedly planned to get his daughter married to a man in exchange for PKR 1,00,000. Zulfiqar had previously "sold" his two other daughters, the victim's brother told police.

56.title: I-T Dept starts probe against UP businessman who hoarded ₹194 cr cash
56.article_body: The Income Tax Department has started an investigation against Kanpur-based perfume businessman Piyush Jain. In December 2021, the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) had recovered over ₹194.45 crore cash, 23 kg gold and 600 kg sandalwood from the factory premises of Jain. According to reports, the DGGI had officially shared the information with the Income Tax Department last week.

57.title: Middle overs partnerships could've changed result: Velocity captain Deepti
57.article_body: Following her side's four-run loss against Supernovas in Women’s T20 Challenge final, Velocity captain Deepti Sharma said, “Had we built partnerships in the middle overs, it would not have come down to this.” She added, “Batters did not take responsibility, but Laura Wolvaardt and Simran Bahadur played really well.” Chasing a 166-run target, Velocity managed 161/8 in 20 overs.

58.title: He gets the best out of me: Hardik on GT head coach Nehra
58.article_body: GT skipper Hardik Pandya lauded head coach Ashish Nehra, saying he gets the best out of him and he always enjoys his company. "For me, playing and spending so much time with him is always fun...our cricketing minds work in a similar fashion," he added. Debutants GT will play against RR in the final of IPL 2022 today.

59.title: Kartik Aaryan shares pic as 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earns ₹100cr
59.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan shared a picture of himself smiling on social media on Sunday, writing, "100 crore wali smile. #BhoolBhulaiyaa2." This comes after his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned over ₹100 crore in less than ten days of its release. The film earlier beat Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' to become 2022's biggest Hindi opener at the Indian box office.

60.title: Set target to win 75 seats in UP in LS polls: CM to BJP workers
60.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed BJP workers in state to begin preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls and set a target to win 75 seats. In 2019, BJP had won 62 Lok Sabha seats, while its ally Apna Dal(S) bagged two seats. BJP won a second term in UP, bagging 255 seats in state's recent Assembly polls.

61.title: North Korean drone entering J&K from Pak shot down; magnetic bombs, grenades recovered
61.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Sunday said they have shot down a North Korean drone in Kathua district which was entering from Pakistan side. SSP Kathua RC Kotwal said seven UBGL (Under Barrel Grenade Launcher) grenades and seven sticky/magnetic bombs were recovered from the payload attached to the hexacopter. "We've averted a major incident by recovering this material," he added.

62.title: Ranveer shares video rehearsing for IPL finale, does 'Naatu Naatu' step
62.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh on Sunday took to Instagram to share a behind-the-scenes video of the rehearsals for his performance at the 2022 IPL finale. He wrote alongside the video, "Capacity Crowd? Just bring it!" The actor can be seen practicing the hook steps of songs like 'Khalibali' from 'Padmaavat', 'Tattad Tattad' from 'RamLeela' as well as 'Naatu Naatu' from 'RRR'.

63.title: 26 Rohingyas including 12 children detained in Assam
63.article_body: A total of 26 Rohingyas, including 12 children, have been detained by police from Silchar in Assam's Cachar on Sunday. District SP Ramandeep Kaur said that the Rohingyas are Myanmar nationals and didn't have "many documents". "The Rohingyas reached...Kamakhya railway station in Guwahati on Saturday night and travelled to Silchar by road. They were coming from Jammu," the SP added.

64.title: I want to do disruptive content that changes storytelling: Tahir
64.article_body: Actor Tahir Raj Bhasin has stated in an interview that he wants to do "disruptive content" that changes what the notion of storytelling is. The actor further said that he has always received offers for portraying a masala hero but his selection depends on the kind of scripts that he wants to do in the moment.

65.title: If Buttler fires again, then that's it: Aakash on RR-GT IPL 2022 final
65.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said if RR opener Jos Buttler, who's currently the leading run-scorer of IPL 2022, "fires again" in the final against GT on Sunday, then "the boss will play, then that's it". Aakash added, "Jaiswal is playing those explosive knocks...Devdutt Padikkal is a very important player, especially if they are batting first...[RR's] bowling is going very [well]."

66.title: Optimistic about Jos Buttler returning to England Test side: McCullum
66.article_body: England's newly-appointed red-ball coach Brendon McCullum has said that he is optimistic about wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler returning to the English Test team. "Jos is one...you...think how could he be so dominant in one form (and not in Test cricket)," McCullum said. "There's no reason why, if you're good at T20, you can't bring those skills into Test cricket," he added.

67.title: Supporters of Oppn parties will vote for me: Dhami on Champawat bypoll
67.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly bypoll for the Champawat seat, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that even supporters of Opposition parties will give their votes to him. "It's not even a party poll now. Some people were from BSP, SP, Congress and AAP, everyone's now saying that they'll give their vote to me," Dhami added.

68.title: Bicycle thief arrested in B'luru, 54 bicycles worth ₹6 lakh recovered
68.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man, Balraj, for stealing bicycles and recovered 54 bicycles, worth ₹6 lakh from him. Police said that some of the bicycles that Balraj stole cost ₹60,000. Balraj used to sell these bicycles for ₹3,000-4,000, police said, adding that they are yet to find owners of recovered bicycles as many did not file any complaint.

69.title: J&K LG meets family of TV artiste Amreen Bhat killed by terrorists
69.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir Manoj Sinha on Sunday met the family members of 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists. "She was a strong-willed woman and a pillar of support to her family. The administration will provide every possible assistance...to the family. We shall forever remember Amreen's indomitable spirit," Office of LG J&K tweeted.

70.title: Worried over loan repayment, Mumbai constable dies by suicide
70.article_body: A 25-year-old constable, Nikhil Gautam Sable, died by suicide in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg suburb, an official said on Saturday. "He had reportedly taken loans from two prominent private banks, including one which was of ₹2 lakh. He was depressed over repayment," the official added. Sable was found hanging from the ceiling of his home, the official further said.

71.title: Johny Lever celebrates 38th wedding anniversary with Sujatha, shares video
71.article_body: Johny Lever took to Instagram on Saturday to share a video of him clicking a selfie with his wife Sujatha Lever on their 38th wedding anniversary. He wrote, "38 years hogaye shadi ko, ho jaaye ek gulabi selfie (It's been 38 years since our wedding, let's click...pink selfie)." Reacting to Johny's post, a fan wrote, "They look so cute together."

72.title: Children of poor will also become engineers, doctors: Kejriwal in H'yana
72.article_body: Ahead of civic polls, AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said if given a chance, his party will improve the condition of all schools in Haryana. "Children of poor will also become engineers and doctors," Kejriwal added while addressing a rally in Haryana. "We didn't allow private schools of Delhi to increase their fee in past seven years," Kejriwal stated.

73.title: Jharkhand to get WHO award for controlling tobacco consumption
73.article_body: The WHO has selected Jharkhand for the World No-Tobacco Day Award-2022 after recognising its efforts in controlling tobacco consumption, an official said. "It's a great achievement for Jharkhand, which could be possible only due to political and administrative supports that tobacco control cell has got in implementing the programme," National Tobacco Control Programme's state nodal officer said.

74.title: Kanika Kapoor shares pics from court wedding with Gautam Hathiramani
74.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram on Sunday to share pictures from her court wedding with Gautam Hathiramani. One of the pictures showed them holding hands while an officiator stood next to them. They could also be seen signing some documents in one picture. Kanika and Gautam tied the knot as per Hindu traditions on May 20 in London.

75.title: Mbappe is already forgotten: Real Madrid president after Champions League win
75.article_body: Real Madrid president Florentino Perez has said Kylian Mbappe is "already forgotten" after his side defeated Liverpool to win the Champions League/European Cup for a record-extending 14th time. Mbappe was reportedly in talks with Madrid to join the club but signed a contract extension until 2025 at PSG. "Madrid will continue to work on having the best players," added Perez.

76.title: Don't know if we're just seeing the tip of the iceberg: WHO on monkeypox surge
76.article_body: WHO addressed the "unusual" spread of monkeypox in non-endemic countries, saying, "We don't know if we are just seeing the peak of the iceberg." WHO official Sylvie Briand said, "We're still at the very, very beginning of this event." She added, "We know we'll have more cases in the coming days." Over 200 cases have been reported so far.

77.title: NSA invoked against jailed SP leader Rizwan Zaheer
77.article_body: The National Security Act has been invoked against jailed SP leader Rizwan Zaheer. The act has been invoked against Zaheer to maintain public peace and order, the Superintendent of Police Rajesh Kumar Saxena said. Notably, Zaheer is in jail for the past five months in connection with the murder of the Tulsipur Nagar Panchayat's former chairman.

78.title: Locals said it crashed in river: Nepal Army on plane carrying 22 people including 4 Indians
78.article_body: Nepal Army spokesperson Narayan Silwal has said that based on the information given by locals, the missing Tara Air plane carrying 22 people, including four Indians, crashed at the mouth of the Lamche river. "Nepal Army is moving towards the site from the ground and air route," he added. The  aircraft lost contact around 10 am on Sunday.

79.title: Warne's RR were only team to come to stadium at 7.25 pm for 8 pm matches: Irfan Pathan
79.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has revealed that Shane Warne-led Rajasthan Royals (RR) were the only team in IPL 2008 to come to the stadium at 7.25 pm for 8 pm matches. Irfan added, "Warne was way ahead of his time. He thought, 'Players will get tired because it's summer season and I won't let that happen. I'll conserve their energy'."

80.title: BJP will make your children goons, rioters and rapists: Kejriwal
80.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Haryana, said those who want their children to become goons, rioters and rapists should send them to the BJP. "Those who want their children to become doctors, engineers, lawyers, come with us [AAP]," he added. "They'll teach your children to riot and send their children abroad," Kejriwal said.

81.title: Russia won't use tactical nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Russia's UK envoy
81.article_body: Russian Ambassador to the UK Andrei Kelin on Sunday told BBC that he doesn't believe that Moscow would use tactical nuclear weapons in Ukraine. He said that according to Russian military rules, such weapons aren't used in "conflicts like this". Moscow has a "strict provision" for the use of such weapons, mainly when the state's "existence is endangered", he added.

82.title: Putin warns France, Germany against supplying arms to Ukraine
82.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz against continuing to supply arms to Ukraine. He said it would further destabilise the situation and aggravate the humanitarian crisis. On the other hand, Macron and Scholz called for an immediate ceasefire and asked Putin to talk directly to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

83.title: Alec Baldwin's mother passes away, granddaughter Hailey Bieber pays tribute
83.article_body: Carol Baldwin, the mother of actor Alec Baldwin and grandmother of Hailey Bieber, passed away on May 27 aged 92 in New York. Hailey, daughter of Stephen Baldwin and Kennya Baldwin, took to Instagram to share a post mourning the demise of her grandmother. "Today I celebrate her, the life she lived, and the legacy she leaves behind," she wrote.

84.title: Congress leader booked for cleaning statue of Rajiv Gandhi with his turban
84.article_body: The Joint Co-coordinator of Kisan Congress, Gursimran Singh Mand, has been booked for hurting religious sentiments by cleaning a statue of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi with his turban in Punjab. In July 2021, Mand had cleaned the statue after two Nihang Sikhs had set the statue on fire. Sikh organisations had raised objections over his move.

85.title: Like Aryan Khan, I'm a victim of made-up case: Jharkhand CM on MGNREGA scam
85.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said that actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was found to be victim of made-up case and that is how he sees the Enforcement Directorate case against himself. The ED is probing a money laundering case related to irregularities in MGNREGA funds disbursement and alleged money laundering in mining lease allocation in Jharkhand.

86.title: German auto company to launch facility in Hyd, employ 3,000 people
86.article_body: A German auto company, ZF, is set to launch its latest facility in Hyderabad's Nanakramguda, Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao confirmed on Friday. The upcoming branch is set to be the company's largest facility among its other branches across 100 locations and 18 major development centres globally, KTR added. The proposed facility will provide employment to 3,000 people.

87.title: Munawar Faruqui's team confirms he will join 'Khatron Ke...': Report
87.article_body: 'Lock Upp' season one winner Munawar Faruqui will reportedly be joining 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', his team has confirmed. As per a report by News18, his team has confirmed that Munawar will join the 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' team later. This comes amid rumours that Munawar had dropped out of the show. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' shoot will begin next month.

88.title: Can't incentivise delivery agents to break traffic rules: Mahua on 10-minute deliveries
88.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Sunday tweeted that she will raise the issue of 10-minute deliveries offered by food-ordering apps, in the Parliament. She wrote, "10-minute deliveries need to be regulated or outlawed. No civilised society can be incentivising delivery executives to break traffic rules and put their own and others' lives at risk. All for a quicker pizza."

89.title: Will take back disputed land occupied by India: Nepal PM
89.article_body: Nepal's PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on Saturday said that his government is committed to taking back the "disputed land currently occupied by India". He asserted that Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura are Nepali territories. His statement came after former PM KP Oli criticised the government for failing to take back the "occupied land".

90.title: Fire breaks out in Thane factory, exploding cylinders cause panic
90.article_body: Several commercial establishments, including 13 shops, were damaged after a major fire broke out in a factory manufacturing scientific equipment in Thane's Wagle Estate area on Saturday. The fire was sparked by an LPG cylinder blast in the factory, an official said. Explosions caused by remaining gas cylinders in the factory had caused panic in the locality, eyewitnesses said.

91.title: 25 people missing after cargo boat sinks in Indonesia; 17 rescued
91.article_body: At least 25 people are still missing after a cargo boat carrying about 42 people sank in Makassar Strait in Indonesia, officials said on Sunday. According to South Sulawesi's search and rescue agency head Djunaidi, 17 people have been rescued so far, including those who were found by passing tugboats. The boat reportedly sank due to bad weather.

92.title: I've been impressed but I'd encourage Tilak to not ignore his bowling: Sachin
92.article_body: Talking about MI batter Tilak Varma, Sachin Tendulkar said the 19-year-old is a "promising cricketer who has a fantastic future". Sachin added, "He is fit, quick between the wickets. He even bowls some off-spin. I would encourage Tilak to not ignore his bowling...Overall, I have been impressed with him." Tilak scored 397 runs in 14 games in IPL 2022.

93.title: Debates on Gyanvapi case shouldn't be entertained in modern India: RLD chief
93.article_body: Debates such as those on Gyanvapi case should not be entertained in modern democratic India, RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said on Sunday. "If you look at it, the law does not allow these sorts of debates (like the ongoing Gyanvapi issue) anymore…Let us not look to create more disturbances for the future using our past as an excuse," Chaudhary added.

94.title: Which are the highest grossing films of 2022 globally so far?
94.article_body: Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is the highest-grossing film of 2022 globally, having earned over $820 million so far. It is followed by 'The Batman', which has earned $769 million. 'The Batman' is followed by 'Water Gate Bridge' (over $626 million) and 'Uncharted' (around $400 million).

95.title: Foetus found growing inside 40-day-old baby in a rare medical condition in Bihar
95.article_body: A foetus was found to be growing inside a 40-day-old baby in Bihar's Motihari in a rare medical condition called 'fetus-in-fetu'. "The infant has undergone surgery and his condition is now stable," Dr Tabrez Aziz of the Rahmania Medical Centre said. The condition has been defined as the presence of one of the twins in the body of the other.

96.title: Know him well, charges are false: Maneka on officer transferred in dog walking row
96.article_body: BJP MP Maneka Gandhi has defended IAS officer Sanjeev Khirwar who was transferred from Delhi for allegedly closing a stadium early to walk his dog. Calling his transfer "wrong", Gandhi said, "I know Khirwar very well. The allegations against him are false." Saying that "Delhi benefitted from his work" in the Environment Department, Maneka called Khirwar's transfer "Delhi's loss".

97.title: Johnny Depp to make comeback with 'Beetlejuice 2': Reports
97.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp will be making a comeback with upcoming film 'Beetlejuice 2' post the defamation trial that he filed against his ex-wife actress Amber Heard, as per reports. Reports state that actors Michael Keaton and Winona Ryder may reprise their roles from the original 1988 film. Johnny's defamation case has been dismissed to be deliberated upon by the jury.

98.title: There's Hindi industry & there's something called AK industry: Sajid on Akshay
98.article_body: Sajid Nadiadwala, who has worked with Akshay Kumar in films like 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Housefull', spoke about the actor as he completed 30 years in the film industry. "There's...Telugu industry, Hindi industry and there's something called...AK industry. He's got his industry on his own," he said, adding Akshay "needs immense applause" for the work he has done in the industry.

99.title: Hardik Pandya has poise that is typical of winners: GT team director
99.article_body: GT team director Vikram Solanki, speaking about Hardik Pandya, has said, "Hardik has a poise that is typical of winners." He further called Hardik a passionate cricketer. "He's somebody that has clearly been through a great deal in his life, both as a cricketer and as a person...he uses those experiences to...lead the way he does," Vikram added.

100.title: 4 held for robbing senior citizen of cash, jewellery in Mumbai
100.article_body: A senior citizen was robbed of his cash and jewellery amounting to ₹1.87 lakhs in Mumbai.  The officials of the Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly committing the crime. Notably, the accused disguised as delivery men before allegedly tying the victim at the latter's house, which comes under the jurisdiction of the Malad Police Station, police said.

101.title: No agency can stop work as lord wants it: BJD leader on Puri corridor
101.article_body: Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra said that no one can stop the ongoing construction work of the heritage corridor in Odisha's Puri as the lord wants it. "The construction work is going on round the clock. It is also the wish of Lord Jagannath that the project work is finished at the earliest," Misra added.

102.title: Kerala man dies of West Nile fever, state Health Department sounds alert
102.article_body: Kerala on Sunday reported the death of a 47-year-old man due to West Nile fever. The disease, which is generally spread by the Culex species of mosquitoes, had earlier claimed a life in Kerala in 2019. The state Health Department has sounded an alert in the wake of the death. Officials said the victim was treated at various hospitals.

103.title: She was outstanding: Harmanpreet on Sophie's last over in Supernova's win
103.article_body: Praising teammate Sophie Ecclestone for her "outstanding" last over which helped Supernovas win against Velocity by four runs in final of Women's T20 Challenge, Supernovas skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said Ecclestone was quite confident. "If you've a bowler who is so confident, half the job is done," she added. With 17 runs needed off the final over, Velocity managed only 12.

104.title: Akshay, Manushi head to Somnath Temple ahead of 'Samrat...' release
104.article_body: Actors Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar along with Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi are headed to Somnath Temple, Varanasi and Rai Pithora ahead of 'Samrat Prithviraj' release. They are also going to plant Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan’s flag at the Rai Pithora fort. "We are...travelling with Samrat Prithviraj's flag...to seek blessings with the flag that represented freedom for our country," Dwivedi said.

105.title: Joined industry 40 yrs ago, I'm full of gratitude that I survived: Archana
105.article_body: Archana Puran Singh said she joined the entertainment industry 40 years ago and had to work extremely hard "as those were times when...industry was quite different from what it is today". "I used to see others who started...with me and were doing extremely well...but today...many of them are nowhere to be found," Archana said, adding, "I'm full of gratitude...I survived."

106.title: Hardik Pandya is knocking on the door of Indian captaincy: Shoaib Akhtar
106.article_body: Talking about GT captain Hardik Pandya's leadership skills, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that the all-rounder "is knocking on the door of Indian captaincy". Akhtar added, "Hardik has proved his point (as a leader) but he still needs to focus on his fitness and bowling." Hardik has guided GT to the final in their inaugural IPL season.

107.title: That's on your hands: Man to US lawmaker over Texas shooting
107.article_body: A man confronted US Senator Ted Cruz, who addressed an event of the National Rifles Association, over the shooting at Texas school in which 21 people, including 19 children, died. "Nineteen children died! That's on your hands, Ted Cruz," the man, identified as Benjamin Hernandez, was heard saying in a video that was widely shared.

108.title: Myanmar refugees in B'desh could resort to extremism: Minister
108.article_body: Refugees from Myanmar residing in Bangladesh could resort to extremism, Bangladesh's Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen said on Saturday. Momen, who was speaking at an event in Guwahati, urged for the refugees' urgent repatriation, adding that several of them were engaging in crimes, including drug and human trafficking. An estimated 1.1 million Rohingya refugees reportedly reside in Bangladesh.

109.title: MI have to lift sixth IPL trophy anyhow: Suryakumar Yadav on IPL 2023
109.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, in a video shared by Mumbai Indians' Twitter account, said that his side has to win their sixth IPL trophy by the next season. "It's unfortunate that this can't happen this year, fifth or sixth trophy, but next year, we've to add one more trophy anyhow," he stated. MI finished last on IPL 2022 points table.

110.title: Iranian police use tear gas against building collapse protesters
110.article_body: Iranian police used tear gas and fired shots in the air to disperse people protesting over the collapse of a 10-storey building in Abadan, in which at least 29 people have died, according to local media reports. The protest had turned violent as people forcefully entered the building's ruins while the rescue operations were still on, reported Fars News Agency.

111.title: People said 'We have a bet that you are Kajal bhai': Bhairavi on 'Hum Paanch'
111.article_body: Television actress Bhairavi Raichura who was seen as Kajal Bhai in 'Hum Paanch' said that once she went to play garba during Navratri and people came up to her saying that they have a bet that she is Kajal Bhai. "That's when I felt...that people know me," she said, adding that truck and auto drivers got excited on seeing her.

112.title: Shanghai to ease some COVID curbs to return to normal life: Official
112.article_body: China's Shanghai will ease COVID-19 testing requirements from June 1 for people who want to enter public areas or use the public transport. The adjustments to the testing requirements were made to "resume work and a return to normal life", an official said. However, there will be no change in testing requirements for people leaving the city, the official added.

113.title: They should try Rashid Khan: Manjrekar on GT's bowling plan against Buttler
113.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said GT should bring in spinner Rashid Khan in the powerplay against RR opener Jos Buttler in the IPL 2022 final on Sunday. "Rashid bowls stump to stump. Whenever Buttler has been in trouble, it has been with that line," explained Manjrekar. Buttler is currently the leading run-getter of IPL 2022 with 824 runs.

114.title: Zoho CEO encouraging youth: PM as he lauds his push for rural entrepreneurship
114.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded Zoho CEO and Padma Shri awardee Sridhar Vembu for his push for rural entrepreneurship and called him a "successful entrepreneur". "He has...taken up upon himself the task of grooming other entrepreneurs...He's encouraging rural youth to do something in this area, staying in the village itself," PM said during the latest episode of 'Mann Ki Baat'.

115.title: Hyderabad Police receive funds for families of deceased officials
115.article_body: Rachakonda Security Council (RKSC), a non-profit society, contributed funds worth ₹8 lakh to Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday. A cheque of ₹5 lakh was donated towards a welfare fund for families of those police officials who had died in the line of duty. An additional ₹3 lakh was donated towards police's free pre-recruitment training initiative aimed at helping police aspirants.

116.title: Student activist accused of sexually harassing woman in JNU campus
116.article_body: An All India Students Association (AISA) activist has been accused of sexually harassing a woman inside the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi. According to a statement issued by the Concerned Women of JNU, the woman was inappropriately touched by the accused without her consent. AISA said the complaint has been forwarded to its Gender Sensitisation Committee for enquiry.

117.title: Govt withdraws advisory warning people against sharing photocopy of Aadhaar
117.article_body: The Centre on Sunday withdrew its press note advising people against sharing details and photocopies of their Aadhaar card with any organisation to avoid misuse. Stating that the advisory was issued by UIDAI's Bengaluru office, the government said, "In view of the possibility of the misinterpretation of the Press Release, the same stands withdrawn with immediate effect."

118.title: ONGC becomes India's 2nd most profitable firm after its record net profit in FY22
118.article_body: ONGC reported a net profit of ₹40,305 crore in the fiscal year that ended March 31, becoming India's second most profitable company after Reliance Industries. ONGC's net profit for FY22 surged 258% from ₹11,246.44 crore in FY21. The company replaced Tata Steel from the number two spot, which had reported a standalone net profit of ₹33,011.18 crore for FY22.

119.title: RR should get 24-26 runs off Rashid: Vettori ahead of IPL 2022 final
119.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final, Daniel Vettori said RR should be looking to score "24-26 runs" in GT spinner Rashid Khan's four-over spell. "Letting him go for 0 for 15 in four overs...sets up...rest of the bowlers," he stated. "I understand you want to restrict wickets, but in this game, runs are going to be...important," he added.

120.title: 7 killed, 9 injured as tourist bus collides with truck on UP highway
120.article_body: Seven persons were killed and nine others were seriously injured when a tourist bus collided with a truck on the Bahraich-Lakhimpur highway in Uttar Pradesh on Sunday, police said. The truck driver managed to escape, ASP Ashok Kumar said. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has condoled the deaths and directed officials concerned to ensure that the injured get good medical treatment.

121.title: Mumbai Police fly to UP to catch murder accused, find him in train’s toilet
121.article_body: A Mumbai Police team that was sent to Uttar Pradesh to catch a man, Ansar Ali Hifazat Ali alias Samir, who had allegedly killed his wife in Goregaon, found the accused hiding in toilet of sleeper train in Prayagraj. The police team was sent by flight because catching accused in running train was difficult. Ansar has been arrested.

122.title: Asked China to review policies impacting Uyghurs: UN rights chief
122.article_body: UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet, who just visited China, said she has asked the country to review its policies concerning rights of Uyghur Muslims. "I have raised questions and concerns about the application of counter-terrorism and deradicalisation measures under broad application, particularly the impact on the rights of Uyghurs and other predominantly Muslim minorities," she said.

123.title: How much prize money will IPL 2022 winners, runners-up get?
123.article_body: The winners of the IPL 2022 final between Rajasthan Royals and Gujarat Titans will get a prize money of ₹20 crore. This season's runners-up will receive ₹13 crore, while the Most Valuable Player will be awarded ₹12 lakh. The tournament's highest wicket-taker and highest run-scorer will also get ₹15 lakh each.

124.title: India's largest gold reserves of over 222 mn tonnes to be explored in Bihar
124.article_body: Gold reserves of around 222.88 million tonnes, said to be India's largest, present in Bihar's Jamui will be explored after the state's approval. This came after a Geological Survey of India (GSI) survey indicated the presence of gold in areas like Karmatia, Jhajha and Sono in Jamui. Bihar's gold stockpiles account for 44% of the country's total reserves of gold.

125.title: Remember demonetisation: Derek O'Brien on RBI report on fake notes
125.article_body: After the RBI released its annual report claiming that ₹500 denomination's counterfeit notes saw an increase of 101.9% during 2021-22, TMC MP Derek O'Brien commented on the Centre's 2016 demonetisation move. "Namaskar PM Modi... Demonetisation? Remember? And how CM Mamata Banerjee swiftly took you on? How you promised the nation that it would wipe out all counterfeit currency," O'Brien tweeted.

126.title: Monsoon rains hit India 3 days ahead of schedule
126.article_body: The southwest monsoon has reached Kerala three days ahead of its normal onset time, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. Earlier this month, the IMD had said that the monsoon onset over Kerala would take place on May 27 and predicted normal rainfall with chances of 99% rainfall of the Long Period Average.

127.title: I think Gujarat Titans are favourites to win IPL final: Brett Lee
127.article_body: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee has said that Gujarat Titans are favourites to win the IPL 2022 finals. "First year in the competition, they've (GT) played out of their skins...But, rather than single out individual players, I like how they have played collectively," Lee said. He added that GT's coaches, Ashish Nehra and Gary Kirsten, have done a good job.

128.title: Delhi judge's wife found dead after missing report, 3 suicide notes found: Police
128.article_body: Wife of Additional Sessions Judge was found dead at her brother's house in Delhi's Rajpur Khurd area, police said, adding that a missing complaint of the 42-year-old woman was filed at Saket police station on Saturday night. Police further said that three suicide notes were recovered after the body was found upon investigation.

129.title: India issues emergency hotline number as Nepal plane with 4 Indians goes missing
129.article_body: The Embassy of India in Kathmandu has issued an emergency hotline number, +977-9851107021, after Nepal's Tara Air aircraft went missing with four Indians on board. The embassy tweeted, "Search and rescue operation is on. The embassy is in touch with their family." The missing plane was carrying 22 people including the crew members.

130.title: 97 children fall sick after eating pani puri at MP fair, seller detained
130.article_body: As many as 97 children were hospitalised as they suffered from food poisoning after eating pani puri at a fair in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla, a health official said on Sunday. The children complained of vomiting and stomach pain, he added. According to a police officer, the pani puri seller was detained and samples of the snack were sent for testing.

131.title: Harrison Ford's 'Indiana Jones 5' to release on June 30, 2023
131.article_body: The fifth instalment in the 'Indiana Jones' film franchise is all set to release in theatres on June 30, 2023, actor Harrison Ford has announced. The adventure film has been directed by James Mangold, the filmmaker behind films like 'Ford v Ferrari', 'The Wolverine' and 'Logan'. It'll also feature Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Thomas Kretschmann, Antonio Banderas and Mads Mikkelsen, among others.

132.title: Energy Parag brings with his game on the field is amazing: Malinga
132.article_body: Former Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga praised Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag's fielding in the ongoing IPL. "The energy he brings with his game on the field is amazing...This is the attitude we need," he said. This comes after Parag broke Ravindra Jadeja's record for the most catches in a single IPL season by an Indian player.

133.title: We had more shots on target: Liverpool coach Klopp after losing CL final
133.article_body: After losing the Champions League final to Real Madrid by 0-1 on Saturday, Liverpool coach Jurgen Klopp has claimed that their side had "more shots on target". "The most decisive stat is on Madrid's side," Klopp said. "The stats are 50-50 but, apart from the goal, they (Madrid) did not have a shot on target," the 54-year-old coach added.

134.title: Akshay, Parineeti to star in film on Raniganj Coalfield rescue mission: Reports
134.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Parineeti Chopra are reportedly teaming up again, after 'Kesari', for a film based on the 1989 Raniganj Coalfield rescue mission. According to reports, the film will tell the story of mining engineer Jaswant Singh Gill, who had rescued 64 miners trapped in a flooded coal mine. Titled 'Capsule Gill', it'll reportedly be directed by Tinu Suresh Desai.

135.title: WWE legend Ric Flair's daughter Charlotte Flair marries AEW star Andrade, shares pic
135.article_body: WWE star Charlotte Flair, who is the daughter of WWE legend Ric Flair, got married to AEW star  Andrade El Idolo. The duo got married in Mexico in a ceremony that was attended by 160 people. The couple had got engaged in January 2020. "Before I met him, I did not know anything except my job," Charlotte said.

136.title: Parents were supportive, some family members were against it: Shivangi on acting
136.article_body: Television actress Shivangi Joshi said that her parents were really supportive when she decided to take up acting as a career but some family members were against it. "I and my mom came to Mumbai from Dehradun, nobody knew us back then. So that step and journey were really tough for me," she added.

137.title: Many working towards strengthening language diversity in India: PM
137.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during the Mann Ki Baat programme said there are many people who are working towards strengthening the language diversity in India. "For example, Sripati Tudu from West Bengal has translated the Constitution of India in 'Ol Chiki' script for the Santhali community," PM Modi added. "India has different languages and dialects," PM Modi stated.

138.title: Person caught wheeling in Bengaluru; traffic police share video
138.article_body: Bengaluru's DCP (Traffic West Division) Kuldeep Kumar R Jain on Sunday tweeted that Kengeri traffic police have caught a person who was wheeling in the city and shared a video of the incident. "In last one week, we've caught and booked six wheeling cases against different people," he said. A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "Good work sir."

139.title: Locals heard an unusual sound like a bang: Official as Nepal plane goes missing
139.article_body: After Nepal's Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians went missing, Ram Kumar Dani, DSP of Mustang Police Office said, "Locals have called and informed they have heard an unusual sound as if there was some bang." A spokesperson at Nepal's Home Ministry said three helicopters including Army chopper have been deployed for the search of missing aircraft.

140.title: Chahal is the Jos Buttler of the bowling department: Harbhajan Singh
140.article_body: Praising RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal for his performance in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh termed the 31-year-old as the 'Jos Buttler' of the bowling department. "Chahal is the only slow bowler...who is bowling like a spinner...Other spinners are bowling quick and are spinners for namesake," added Harbhajan. Currently, Chahal is the joint-leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022 along with Wanindu Hasaranga.

141.title: On what criteria RSS decides that only BJP leaders are Hindus: Siddaramaiah
141.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the RSS in a series of tweets on Saturday. "Don't they (RSS) see Hindus outside BJP?...Based on what criteria has RSS decided that only BJP leaders are Hindus?" Siddaramaiah asked. "How many RSS office-bearers are from Dalits and backward classes?" he added. The 73-year-old politician also accused RSS of being an "Aryan" organisation.

142.title: Pune woman who cheated 29 investors of ₹1.82 crore arrested
142.article_body: A 53-year-old woman from Pune was arrested for allegedly cheating 29 investors of about ₹1.82 crore, officials said on Saturday. The accused and her husband used to lure investors by promising high returns, a police official said. A case was filed against the woman and her husband, who had been on the run for eight months, the police official added.

143.title: Don't think I can do much more: Real Madrid's Benzema on Ballon d'Or
143.article_body: After winning the Champions League, Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema was asked if the Ballon d'Or was on his mind. To this, he replied, "Of course...I don't think I can do much more with my club." Benzema scored 44 goals for the club in the season. He finished as the top scorer in La Liga and the Champions League.

144.title: Two held for running organised Hookah centre in Hyderabad
144.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested two men for allegedly running an organised Hookah centre in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills area. The accused, identified as Syed Imran (30) and Syed Ahmed (22), allegedly provided Hookah and its accessories to their known customers. Notably, Imran's Hookah parlour got shut down after the government decided to ban Hookah in Hyderabad in 2017, police said.

145.title: Another Tara Air plane crashed on same Nepal route in 2016 killing 23 passengers
145.article_body: In 2016, a Tara Air plane carrying 23 passengers from Pokhara to Jomsom in Nepal lost contact and was later found crashed, killing all passengers on board. While the total time of the flight was 19 minutes, it lost contact eight minutes after taking off. On Sunday, another Tara Air flight travelling on the same route has been reported missing.

146.title: 12 bikes, 1 car burnt in Pune building fire; fuel tanks, tyres explode
146.article_body: One car and 12 bikes were burnt after fire broke out in parking lot of a residential building in Pune's Katraj area on Saturday night. Katraj fire station officer said that by the time the team reached the spot, fuel tanks and tyres were exploding. He added that the fire is suspected to have started from four-wheeler in parking lot.

147.title: Crude bombs hurled, houses vandalised as TMC factions clash in WB
147.article_body: Crude bombs were thrown and at least 12 houses were vandalised after a clash broke out between two factions of TMC in West Bengal's Malda on Saturday. One of the groups was led by a panchayat samiti office-bearer, while the other by TMC's area chief. TMC MLA Sabitri Mitra said that the incident had nothing to do with the party.

148.title: Russia claims full control over Ukraine's railway centre Lyman
148.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry on Saturday claimed that the Ukrainian town Lyman, which is a railway centre, has been "completely liberated" and is under the full control of its forces. This comes a day after Ukraine also claimed that Russian forces had captured most of Lyman, however, the former country's forces were blocking the latter's advance to the city of Sloviansk.

149.title: Indian startups continued to make wealth & value during COVID-19: PM Modi
149.article_body: In the latest episode of 'Mann Ki Baat', PM Narendra Modi while noting that the number of unicorns in India had crossed the 100-mark, said startups continued to create wealth and value even during COVID-19. He added, "Of our total unicorns, 44 came up last year. Not only that, 14 more unicorns were formed anew in three-four months this year."

150.title: Peter could've supported me, this is one reason I filed for divorce: Indrani Mukerjea
150.article_body: After being released on bail in Sheena Bora murder case, former media executive Indrani Mukerjea said, "My least expectations were that he (ex-husband Peter Mukerjea) could've supported me in every way." "When I used to meet Peter at court...he regretted not hearing my side of the story. This is one of the reasons I filed for the divorce," she added.

151.title: How could Aryan Khan be imprisoned without evidence?: Chidambaram
151.article_body: After the NCB gave a clean chit to actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan in the cruise drugs case, Congress leader P Chidambaram asked, "How could he be arrested and imprisoned for 25 days without evidence?" Furthermore, NCP leader Clyde Crasto tweeted, "Who will be held responsible for...trauma this young man (Aryan) suffered?"

152.title: That's not right at pilgrim site: PM Modi on garbage heaps in Kedarnath
152.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said pilgrims in Kedarnath are saddened by litter spread by some devotees. "If we go on a holy pilgrimage and there is a heap of filth, it's not right," PM added during the Mann Ki Baat programme. "There are also some pilgrims who are cleaning nearby areas of their stay during their yatra," PM stated.

153.title: Johar to launch Saif's son Ibrahim in B'wood with 'Hridayam' remake: Report
153.article_body: Karan Johar is reportedly planning to launch Ibrahim Ali Khan, son of Saif Ali Khan and Amrita Singh, in Bollywood. Ibrahim will reportedly appear in the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film 'Hridayam', which will be produced by Johar and Star Studios. Ibrahim is also working as assistant director on Johar's upcoming movie 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

154.title: Don't know whether I'll be able to return to Dabangg franchise: Sonu
154.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about if he will be returning to Salman Khan-starrer 'Dabangg' franchise, said, "I don't know whether I'll be able to return to the 'Dabangg' franchise or not." Sonu played the villain in the 2010 film. Sonu was asked if he is part of 'Singh Is Kinng 2', to which he replied, "I don't know."

155.title: BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma booked over comment on Prophet
155.article_body: BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma has been booked over her comment on the Prophet Muhammad during a recent TV news debate. She is facing charges such as outraging religious sentiments based on a complaint by Raza Academy, a Muslim body in Maharashtra. Sharma claimed she received rape and death threats online after fact-checker Mohammed Zubair posted a clip of the debate.

156.title: Started smoking 'ganja' in 2018 in US to get relief from sleeping disorder: Aryan to NCB
156.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan told NCB that he started consuming 'ganja' during his graduation days in 2018 in the US to get relief from a sleeping disorder. Aryan told the agency that he read a few internet articles about how ganja can help him with sleeping disorder. Aryan recently got a clean chit in last year’s drugs-on-cruise case.

157.title: If I'm prepared for scene, Govinda's film's songs play in my vanity van: Yami
157.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam Dhar said that if she is prepared for a scene and if it is not a heavy scene, she plays songs by composer AR Rahman or songs from actor Govinda's films in her vanity van. "There is 'Friends' (the show) playing on my Ipad. It is there in the background. It just makes me happy," she added.

158.title: It will happen again: Chidambaram on Aryan Khan drugs case
158.article_body: After Aryan Khan was given clean chit in drugs case, Congress leader P Chidambaram took to Twitter to quote an editorial saying, "What was done to Aryan Khan mustn't happen again." Chidambaram said, "Unfortunately, it will happen again. Only the courts can stop the misuse of law." "And when it happens again, I'd like to see media reporting," he added.

159.title: What is a masked Aadhaar card that Centre has advised people to use?
159.article_body: The Centre in its latest advisory has asked the public to use masked Aadhaar cards to avoid misuse of their information. In a masked Aadhaar, the first eight digits are written as 'xxxx-xxxx' while the last four digits are visible, thereby preventing the leak of the full Aadhaar card number. Masked Aadhaar cards can be downloaded from UIDAI's official website.

160.title: Bishnoi will be a big star for India in the upcoming years: Rashid Khan
160.article_body: GT's Rashid Khan has praised LSG spinner Ravi Bishnoi, stating that the 21-year-old is going to be a "big star" in the upcoming years. "I've talked to Bishnoi quite a few times...If he trusts his skills and continues to back them up, he'll definitely be a big bowler," stated Rashid. Bishnoi picked 13 wickets in 14 games in IPL 2022.

161.title: I can't cope with colleagues having surgeries to change faces, bodies: Radhika
161.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said she finds it difficult to cope with the fact that her colleagues have undergone surgeries to change their faces and bodies. "I don't see a lot of people standing up...for it or...standing against it," Radhika said, adding that there are people from industry who talk about body positivity but have had many things (surgeries) done themselves.

162.title: Don't share photocopy of Aadhaar card as it can be misused: Govt's advisory
162.article_body: The Centre has issued a new advisory warning people to not share the photocopy of their Aadhaar cards with any organisation as it can be misused. It further asked the public to use masked copies of the Aadhaar. Organisations that have obtained a user license from the UIDAI can use Aadhaar for establishing the identity of a person, it added.

163.title: Anurag Thakur not worthy of even being councillor: AAP leader
163.article_body: AAP's Naresh Balyan said Union Minister Anurag Thakur is in politics because of his father, otherwise "he isn't worthy of even being a councillor". His remark came in reaction to Thakur's comment on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using the Delhi government-run stadium for walking their dog. "Delhi government did nothing," Thakur said.

164.title: Judges' innerwear is saffron: PFI leader after HC's order on Kerala rally
164.article_body: PFI leader Yahiya Thangal reacted to Kerala High Court ordering police to take action against the party over hate sloganeering at Alappuzha rally, saying that judges are "shocked" by the slogans. The reason for the shock is that judges' "innerwear is saffron", he claimed. A purported video of the rally showed a minor boy raising slogans against Hindus and Christians.

165.title: India not Modi-Shah's, formed as people migrated from Africa, Iran: Owaisi
165.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said India was formed after people migrated from Africa, Iran, Central Asia and East Asia. "India is neither mine, nor Thackeray's, nor Modi-Shah's. If India belongs to anyone, it's Dravidians and Adivasis," he added. "I believe Mughals are responsible for rising petrol prices...Prime Minister is not responsible for anything," Owaisi had earlier said.

166.title: France, Germany ask Putin to release 2,500 Ukrainian prisoners
166.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz reportedly asked Russian President Vladimir Putin to release 2,500 Ukrainian soldiers who were taken as prisoners at Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant. Russia earlier said that around 2,000 Ukrainian soldiers surrendered in Mariupol. The two European leaders persuaded Putin to meet Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy directly.

167.title: In memory of Shane Warne, I hope RR go out there and smash GT: Akhtar
167.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said RR should defeat GT in the IPL 2022 final as a tribute to their ex-captain Shane Warne, who passed away in March this year. Akhtar, however, also added that he wanted one of the new teams to win this season. "Heart says, 'RR win it for Warne'...[but] I will go with GT," he stated.

168.title: 'American Graffiti' star Bo Hopkins passes away after suffering heart attack
168.article_body: American actor Bo Hopkins, who appeared in films like 'American Graffiti', 'The Wild Bunch' and  'Midnight Express', has passed away. The actor, who was in his 80s, died at a hospital in Los Angeles after suffering a heart attack on May 9, his wife Sian told The Hollywood Reporter. Prior to acting, Hopkins had served in the US Army.

169.title: US becomes India's biggest trading partner in 2021-22, surpasses China
169.article_body: The US has surpassed China to become India's biggest trading partner in 2021-2022, according to the data by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry. Bilateral trade between India and the US stood at $119.42 billion in 2021-2022 in contrast to $80.51 billion in 2020-21. Meanwhile, bilateral trade between India and China stood at $115.42 billion in 2021-2022.

170.title: Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat Khan to make her TV debut with 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'
170.article_body: Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat Khan will make her TV debut with the show 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'. "I'm excited to make my debut on the small screen...It’s an opportunity and an honour to make my place in the viewers' heart," she said. Nikhat has worked in several films and has also produced films and shows.

171.title: Sanju Samson's wife trolls IPL broadcasters over animated IPL race video
171.article_body: Sanju Samson's wife Charulatha took to her Instagram Stories to troll IPL broadcasters over an animated IPL race video. "Saw this animated video showing the race for IPL 2022 on the first day of IPL...And wondered why there wasn't any pink jersey," she wrote. RR will face GT in IPL 2022 final tonight.

172.title: Had Cong accepted Savarkar's words, partition wouldn't have happened: Yogi
172.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has claimed that if the then Congress party had listened to VD Savarkar's words then India would have been saved from partition. "Veer Savarkar was never given the honour he deserved...He did not even get his ancestral property till 1960. The word 'Hindutva' was coined by Savarkar," said CM Yogi while releasing a book on Savarkar.

173.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after blast in boiler factory in Uttar Pradesh
173.article_body: One person was killed while four others were reportedly injured in a blast that took place at the Frontier Springs Company located in Rania of Akbarpur Kotwali area in Uttar Pradesh. The Station House Officer (SHO) of Akbarpur said that all those injured in the blast were admitted to the hospital.

174.title: Vicky, Kartik, Kriti attend Dinesh Vijan's sister's reception, pics surface
174.article_body: Several celebrities, including Vicky Kaushal, Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon, attended the wedding reception of Pooja Vijan, sister of filmmaker Dinesh Vijan, on Saturday in Mumbai. Bhushan Kumar, Manish Malhotra, Sunny Kaushal and Diana Penty were also among the celebrities who attended the reception at the Taj Mahal Palace, Colaba. Pooja recently tied the knot with Manjot in Mumbai.

175.title: GT will have slight edge over RR in the IPL 2022 final: Suresh Raina
175.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final, Suresh Raina said Gujarat Titans have a "slight edge over" Rajasthan Royals. "[This is] because GT have had a good rest of four-five days and also due to the tempo they've been in this season," he added. However, Raina stated that RR cannot be taken lightly as they have been in "sublime form".

176.title: Guj man kills self over alleged torture in police custody; 5 booked
