351.title: Russia successfully tests hypersonic missile amid war in Ukraine
351.article_body: Russia has said that it has successfully test-fired a hypersonic missile over a distance of about 1,000 kilometres. The Zircon cruise missile was fired from Barents Sea and hit a target in White Sea. Despite the war in Ukraine, Russia has continued to stage high-profile weapons tests to remind the world of its prowess in missile technology, according to Reuters.

352.title: IndiGo fined ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to specially-abled child in Ranchi
352.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has fined IndiGo ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to a specially-abled boy at the Ranchi airport earlier this month. The DGCA said that the "deficient handling" by the airline staff ended up exacerbating the situation. "A more compassionate handling would have smoothened the nerves and calmed the child," DGCA stated.

353.title: Pune ZP launches citizen feedback portal 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'
353.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has launched a social audit and feedback portal called 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'. "Through this programme, we are seeking both appreciation and complaints of...works done through public money," the body's CEO Ayush Prasad said. He added that through the portal, which will be available on Pune ZP's website, citizens can submit feedback with comments and photos.

354.title: 2 women hide 161 cocaine capsules in stomach, held at Delhi Airport
354.article_body: In separate incidents, two women from Uganda were arrested at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after nearly two kilograms of cocaine worth ₹28 crore was found hidden in their stomachs, customs officials said. The women had concealed the cocaine in a total of 161 capsules and swallowed them. They were taken to RML Hospital for removal of capsules.

355.title: Over 1 lakh commuters hop on Delhi's new electric buses in first 3 days
355.article_body: Around one lakh commuters travelled on Delhi's new AC electric buses in first three days after being flagged off by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on May 24. Taking to Twitter, AAP wrote, "Arvind Kejriwal government's e-buses get bumper response from Delhiites." The Delhi government had made travel free of cost for the first three days in the new buses.

356.title: Earlier our best was coming 4th in Olympics but Neeraj changed it all: PT Usha
356.article_body: Former Indian track and field athlete PT Usha has said that Neeraj Chopra winning an Olympic gold medal in javelin throw has "changed" everything for Indian athletics. "Earlier, the best we could do was reach fourth place in the Olympics but Neeraj's feat has changed all," Usha said. She also added that she started following javelin events because of Chopra.

357.title: Trent Boult gives his RR jersey to young fan after Qualifier 2 win, RR share video
357.article_body: RR have shared a video showing Trent Boult giving his RR jersey to a young fan after their victory against RCB in the Qualifier 2 of IPL 2022 on Friday. "How can you not love Trent Boult?" RR wrote alongside the video. Boult registered figures of 4-0-28-1 against RCB. RR will face GT in IPL 2022 final on Sunday.

358.title: Attending film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate: Richa Chadha
358.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha, while remembering her Cannes debut, said attending a "prestigious" film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate. "It's a matter of pride for the entire team if their film is being shown at the...festival," Richa stated. The actress had earlier shared pictures from her visit to the film festival for her films 'Gangs of Wasseypur' and 'Masaan'.

359.title: England can save Test cricket from current downward trend: McCullum
359.article_body: England's newly-appointed red-ball coach Brendon McCullum has said that England is a nation which can save Test cricket from the ongoing "downward trend". "If you look where (Test cricket) sits, it's probably on a slightly downward trend. One nation that can really change things is England, with the tradition and the fan following (of Test cricket)," McCullum said.

360.title: Anil Agarwal meets Bill Gates, says 'his knowledge about India surprises me'
360.article_body: Vedanta Resources' billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal met the world's fourth-richest person Bill Gates during World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos. Sharing a picture with the Microsoft Co-founder, Agarwal wrote on LinkedIn, "He always surprises me with how much he knows about India and his love for Indian food!" He said the two bonded over their initial struggles as first-generation entrepreneurs.

361.title: Which 10 countries topped latest Travel & Tourism Development rankings by WEF?
361.article_body: The World Economic Forum (WEF) recently released its latest Travel and Tourism Development Index, which ranked Japan at the top. The US, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland, Australia, the UK, Singapore and Italy were also among the top 10 countries on the index. India ranked 54th on the global index but topped the South Asia region rankings.

362.title: Viral Bihar girl who hopped to school gets artificial limb, IAS officer shares pic
362.article_body: A 10-year-old girl from Bihar, who was seen hopping to school on one leg in a viral video, got an artificial limb. An image of the girl, named Seema, from Jamui district, has been shared by IAS officer Awanish Sharan. It shows her wearing a prosthetic leg. "Power of social media," Awanish wrote in the caption.

363.title: I draw a line at rape threats: Ex-Zilingo CEO on seeking legal protection in S'pore
363.article_body: Zilingo's former CEO Ankiti Bose has obtained an Expedited Protection Order from Singapore Courts against a Twitter user after being fired from the e-commerce startup. "I fear...there are elements out there that might benefit from intimidating me...by weaponising the media and social media," Bose said. "I've tried to let it go...but I draw the line at rape threats," she added.

364.title: 2 wanted criminals shot dead in Ghaziabad in 2 separate encounters
364.article_body: Ghaziabad Police shot dead two wanted criminals in two separate encounters on Friday. The criminals, identified as Billu and Rakesh, carried a bounty of ₹1 lakh and ₹50,000 on their heads respectively, police said. The first incident took place in Indirapuram and the second in Madhuban Bapudham. Billu was wanted in a double murder case last month.

365.title: RTO to not issue new auto permits in Pune division: Report
365.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office has reportedly decided not to issue new auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division. Pune Regional Transport Officer Ajit Shinde said that there are a large number of autos in the division and to stop this increasing number of autos this decision has been taken. There are reportedly over 82,000 auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division currently.

366.title: Govt to develop framework to check fake reviews on online shopping websites
366.article_body: The central government on Saturday said that in order to protect consumer interest, it will develop a framework to keep a check on fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites. As per an official statement, the framework will be developed after studying the present mechanism being followed by the e-commerce websites and the best practices available globally.

367.title: 'Mr. India' an iconic film, shouldn't be remade: Satish Kaushik
367.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik has said that his 1987 film 'Mr. India', which also starred Anil Kapoor, Amrish Puri and Sridevi, shouldn't be remade or given a sequel today. He added that it's "such an iconic film with such great legacy that if it ever comes out then it can only be pulled off by Anil Kapoor and no other actor".

368.title: Bengaluru police provide green corridor for liver transportation
368.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Friday provided a green corridor for liver transportation between 12.30 pm and 12.40 pm from St John's Medical College Hospital to Apollo Hospital, BG Road. The traffic police also shared a video of the same. Earlier, the traffic police also provided a green corridor for transporting a live heart and a liver separately on May 4.

369.title: Randeep shares his first look as Veer Savarkar from latter's biopic
369.article_body: Randeep Hooda on Saturday unveiled his first look as Vinayak Damodar Savarkar from an upcoming film based on the latter's life. He shared his look on the occasion of Savarkar's 139th birth anniversary. "This is a salute to...one of the tallest unsung heroes of India's struggle for freedom," Randeep wrote. Titled 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', it'll be directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.

370.title: Pune woman trying to buy two-wheeler on OLX cheated of ₹71,060
370.article_body: A woman from Pune was cheated of ₹71,060 by a cyber fraudster who posted an advertisement to sell a two-wheeler on OLX, police said. "The fraudster lured the complainant with an offer to sell the two-wheeler at a low price...But the woman never got the vehicle," an officer said. The victim had contacted the phone number mentioned in the advertisement.

371.title: Tried to built India Bapu, Sardar Patel dreamt of: PM on 8 yrs of NDA govt
371.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, in past eight years, the government made honest efforts to build India as dreamt by Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel. "Bapu wanted an India that would empower the poor, Dalit, victim, tribals, women," he stated. Over the years, government gave top priority to the service and welfare of poor, PM Modi added.

372.title: BMC starts construction of underpasses for animals in Aarey Colony
372.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started building animal underpasses at Mumbai's Aarey Colony in order to avoid animal-human conflict. Currently, three underpasses are being built and 15 more will be built once the monsoon season ends, a BMC official said. Notably, the locations for the underpasses are selected based on the data collected with the help of camera traps.

373.title: Depressed over mother's death, B'luru man dumps ₹1.3 cr BMW car in river
373.article_body: A Bengaluru man, depressed over his mother's death, drove his BMW car worth ₹1.3 crore into Cauvery river. Seeing the car drowning in the river, the localities suspected it to be an accident and informed the police about it. During investigation, the man's family told police that he was depressed and drove his car into the river out of dejection.

374.title: Iran seizes 2 Greek tankers in Persian Gulf amid row over US oil grab
374.article_body: Iranian forces seized two Greek tankers on Friday in helicopter-launched raids in the Persian Gulf, officials said. This comes after Iran warned it would take "punitive action" against Athens over the confiscation of Iranian oil by the US from a tanker held off the Greek coast. Iran's Revolutionary Guards said the tankers were seized due to unspecified violations.

375.title: R Praggnanandhaa writes exam hours after finishing runner-up in chess tournament at 2 am
375.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa appeared for his Class 11 exam at 8.45 am on Friday, hours after finishing runner-up in Chessable Masters tournament. Praggnanandhaa's final match against world number two Ding Liren ended at 2.20 am. "Last few days have been incredibly tiring...it's a first for me, writing exams and playing a tournament simultaneously," he said.

376.title: Starlink has been approved in Nigeria & Mozambique: Elon Musk
376.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to announce that Starlink has been permitted to provide its service in Nigeria and Mozambique. This comes days after Musk answered a tweet about the service launch in Africa, saying, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon." Starlink is currently available in over 30 countries.

377.title: Thanks but no thanks: Ola CEO on Musk's tweet about Tesla manufacturing in India
377.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal responded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet regarding the manufacture of Tesla in India and wrote, "Thanks but no thanks". Earlier, a Twitter user asked Musk if Tesla would be manufactured in India, to which he replied, "Tesla won't put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell & service cars."

378.title: Kohli always wants to be on the front foot no matter what: Manjrekar
378.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's dismissal in IPL 2022's Eliminator, ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Front foot to a short of length bouncing ball cost him his wicket again." "Kohli wanting to be on the front foot no matter what is not helping his cause," added Manjrekar in his tweet. "Mental toughness takes you far...but technical issues cannot be ignored," stated Manjrekar.

379.title: Shouldn't be taken seriously: Gehlot on Chandna's 'free me from post' tweet
379.article_body: After Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna requested state CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" post, the CM said, "[Chandna] might've come under some stress and commented. It should not be taken seriously." Furthermore, Chandna tweeted a day later that he and Gehlot held a "meaningful" discussion and added that the Congress family is "united" for 2023 polls.

380.title: Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career: Sehwag
380.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said that Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career. "This is not the Virat Kohli we know. This is someone else," he added. Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 22.73. He got out for three golden ducks in the tournament.

381.title: 'The Conjuring' house sells for over ₹11 crore in US; pics surface
381.article_body: A US home, which apparently witnessed paranormal activities chronicled in the 2013 horror film The Conjuring, is being sold for $1.525 million (over ₹11 crore). The sellers, paranormal investigators Jenn and Cory Heinzen, had bought the home in 2019 for $439,000 and had set $1.2 million as the asking price. The buyer of the house is a 58-year-old real-estate developer.

382.title: Musk shares cartoon on freeing Twitter's blue bird from a cage, Twitter users react
382.article_body: Amid the Twitter acquisition deal being put on hold, Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a cartoon featuring a caricature resembling him freeing Twitter's iconic blue bird from a cage. Meanwhile, Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus commented, "Despite all my rage, I am still just a bird in a cage." Another Twitter user wrote, "Twitter is about to get more interesting."

383.title: 19-yr-old boy shot dead in Delhi, found lying in pool of blood: Police
383.article_body: A 19-year-old boy was shot dead in Delhi's Khajuri Khas area on Friday and was found lying in a pool of blood, police said. "On physical inspection, a bullet injury mark was found on his chest," DCP (Northeast Delhi) Sanjay Kumar Sain said. "A suspect has been zeroed in and he is being tracked...will be interrogated accordingly," he added.

384.title: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it: Klopp's message to Russia
384.article_body: Talking about the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid being moved from Russia's Saint Petersburg to France's Stade de France, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said, "I am happy...the game is here for thousands of reasons." "[It]...is exactly the right message that Russia should get: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it."

385.title: Ola driver arrested for molesting 15-year-old girl in Mumbai
385.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 29-year-old Ola cab driver for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl and making obscene gestures at her. The accused driver has been identified as Murari Kumar Singh who lives in Goregaon. "He is originally from Bihar. We are also finding out if he has any prior cases against him," the police said.

386.title: UP girl's body found in well with limbs tied 11 days after she went missing
386.article_body: The body of a 16-year-old girl, who went missing 11 days ago, was found in a sack in a well with her hands and legs tied in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. "It seems...someone who knew the girl killed her...threw her body...20 kilometres from her house," police added. This comes after locals detected a foul smell coming from the well.

387.title: Not even Djokovic, Nadal slide as well as Iga Świątek on clay: McEnroe
387.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said he has never seen anyone as smooth as world number one Iga Świątek while playing on clay courts. "She's an incredible athlete. I don't think I've ever seen a player and this includes Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic...move, slide into their backhand, that far open stance two-hander and the forehand," added McEnroe.

388.title: Rachakonda Police detains 2 inter-state drug peddlers under PD Act
388.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Friday invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act against two inter-state drug peddlers. The accused were involved in procuring drugs at cheap rates from Andhra Pradesh and supplying them to Kerala, Maharashtra, Telangana and Karnataka, police said. The two accused, along with eight others, were arrested in December last year while selling ganja in Hyderabad, police said.

389.title: Who'll be held responsible for trauma Aryan Khan suffered?: NCP leader
389.article_body: After NCB gave Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan a clean chit in cruise drugs case, NCP leader Clyde Crasto tweeted, "Who'll be held responsible for...trauma this young man (Aryan) suffered?" "Many questions arise," he added. Furthermore, NCP chief spokesperson Mahesh Tapase claimed that NCB's decision proved that Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik was right when he called the case fake.

390.title: Communal parties like BJP bigger threat than dynastic politics: HD Kumaraswamy
390.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariwarwaadi politics' remark and said that communal politics is a bigger threat to India as compared to dynastic politics. "The danger to nation is not from dynastic parties, it is posed by communal parties like BJP. Parties raising emotive issues to grab political ground are a real threat to democracy," Kumaraswamy said.

391.title: Party will win at least 25 seats in Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: BJP
391.article_body: BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that BJP will win at least 25 parliamentary seats in West Bengal in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, asserting that the party's support base among the masses is still intact. Criticising those who left BJP in Bengal and joined other parties, Chatterjee said, "Those who are leaving the party are opportunists."

392.title: 2 mountaineers killed, 9 injured in Swiss Alps ice fall
392.article_body: A 40-year-old French woman and a 65-year-old Spanish man were killed and nine other mountaineers were injured by falling blocks of ice in the Alps in southern Switzerland on Friday, police said. Seventeen climbers were in the area when the ice blocks broke off at an altitude of 3,400 metres. Seven rescue helicopters were dispatched to evacuate the climbers.

393.title: Which bowlers have been hit for most sixes in an IPL season?
393.article_body: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj has set the record for conceding the most number of sixes in a season of IPL. Siraj has been hit for 31 sixes in IPL 2022. He is followed by his teammate Wanindu Hasaranga, who conceded 30 sixes in IPL 2022. CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo was slammed for 29 sixes in IPL 2018.

394.title: My personal photos, chats are being shared without consent: Ex-Zilingo CEO
394.article_body: Former Zilingo CEO Ankiti Bose on Friday shared an Instagram post about how her private data is being circulated online after she was fired from Zilingo. Ankiti wrote, "My personal photos, chats, documents, records may have...been improperly accessed and circulated without my consent...I've seen versions of them on the internet which are clearly fake…My apps are full of hate messages."

395.title: Switzerland to destroy over 6.2 lakh expired COVID vaccine doses
395.article_body: Switzerland will destroy over 6.2 lakh expired doses of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine, officials said. "It was consciously accepted that under certain circumstances too much vaccine was procured for Switzerland's needs," a Federal Office of Public Health spokesperson said. Nearly 70% of  Switzerland's population is fully vaccinated against the virus, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker.

396.title: Israeli detective used Indian hackers for Russian oligarchs' jobs: Report
396.article_body: Israeli private investigator Aviram Azari, currently in US custody, used Indian hackers to conduct surveillance operations for Russian oligarchs, court filings showed. Independent journalist Scott Stedman told a US court that Azari worked "on surveillance and cyber-intelligence operations" for the oligarchs. Russia's Oleg Deripaska reportedly employed Azari for a business dispute in Austria.

397.title: Porn movies played on screens at airport in Brazil after apparent hack
397.article_body: Porn movies were played on screens at an airport in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro after an apparent hack. Brazil's airport operator, Infraero, said the monitors were advertising screens run by a private company, not official information displays. "Infraero has taken appropriate legal action and filed a case with the federal police," it said in a statement.

398.title: Anonymous donor gives ₹1.3 crore to cover funeral costs of US school shooting victims
398.article_body: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said an anonymous donor paid $175,000 (over ₹1.3 crore) for the funerals of the 21 victims of the mass shooting at an elementary school. "No family who is suffering from incalculable heartbreak at this time will have to worry about a single cost with regard to anything concerning this travesty," Abbott said.

399.title: Indian oil firms' dividend worth $125.5 mn stuck in Russia due to sanctions
399.article_body: A dividend amounting to $125.49 million belonging to Indian oil companies is stuck in Russia due to Western sanctions over the Ukraine war, said an Oil India official. A consortium comprising Oil India, Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation own 23.9% of Russia's Vankorneft oil project and 29.9% of the Tass-Yuryakh oilfield in east Siberia.

400.title: Rachakonda Police arrest 22-yr-old youth for harassing man, his fiancee
400.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 22-year-old youth for harassing a man and his fiancee on social media. According to police, the accused, identified as J Siddu, wanted to marry the victim's fiancee. In order to call off the marriage, Siddu created fake social media profiles and posted the victim's phone number with derogatory and vulgar messages, police added.
